noun.description: Fulfillment of one's wishes, expectations, or needs, or the pleasure derived from this.
examples: managing directors seeking greater job satisfaction

phrases: some amendments were made, not entirely to his satisfaction
That's still a critical question that hasn't been answered to my satisfaction yet.
The police have said that he's answered all questions to their satisfaction.
If the manufacturer doesn't handle your complaints to your satisfaction, seek legal help.
I hope you have found everything to your satisfaction?
origin: Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin satisfactio(n-), from satisfacere satisfy, content (see satisfy). The earliest recorded use referred to the last part of religious penance after contrition and confession: this involved fulfillment of the observance required by the confessor, in contrast with the current meaning fulfillment of one's own expectations.
